110.name: Professional Occupations
110.description: Some use of keyboards but less than 112 or 112; greater standing and walking demands than 112 and 120.

111.name: Professional and Clerical Occupations
111.description: Substantial use of keyboards; greater demands for standing and walking than 112 and 120.

112.name: Mostly Clerical Occupations
112.description: Highest demand for use of keyboard; prolonged sitting.

120.name: Most Technical Occupations
120.description: Precision work requiring skill and dexterity; use of hand tools; more sitting than 110 and 111.

210.name: Mostly Professional Occupations
210.description: Extensive speech and hearing; standing and lifting; may require driving to business locations; other physical demands at the lower end of the light category.

221.name: Light Assembly Occupations, Food Preparation Occupations
221.description: Vision important; repetitive fingering and use of hand tools; similar to 220 for all parts of body except for wrist and finger motion which is one variant lower.

230.name: Machine Operator and Tenders
230.description: Average demands for this strength level on spine and legs; hand activities are most significant.

240.name: Mostly Attendants (providing services)
240.description: Minimal hand activities; low on arm activities; average for 200 series on spine and legs.

250.name: Public Transportation Drivers & Light Delivery Drivers
250.description: Operates light automotive equipment over public thoroughfares; vision, hearing and other head disabilities important; highest variants for spine and leg activities in 200 series (along with 213 & 214); grip demands similar to 251.

251.name: Outside Sales, Inspectors, & Business Agents
251.description: Work requires extensive driving of light automotive equipment over public thoroughfares to reach business locations; vision, hearing and other head disabilities important; average demand for spine and leg activities for this strength level; arms are one variant lower that 250.

290.name: Personal Attendants
290.description: Vision important; cosmetic appearance important; arms variants at high end for 200 series.

310.name: Medical Occupations
310.description: Low end of 300 series for most parts of body; head disabilities, including speech, hearing, PTHS are highest in 300 series.

311.name: Mostly Medical Occupations
311.description: Medical treatments performed result in higher spine demands; head disabilities are at the highest levels.

320.name: Assemblers
320.description: Precision work requiring use of hand tools; highest arm variants for the 320 series; lower end variants for 300 series for spine & leg (same as 321 & 322); highest head variants in 320 series.

321.name: Assemblers
321.description: Use of hand tools required; precision requirements less than 320 – arm variants slightly lower; same demand on spine and legs as 320 & 322.

322.name: Food Preparation and Service Occupations
322.description: Least precise work in 320 series – arm variants the lowest; spine & legs same as 320 & 321

330.name: Press Operators, Sawyers, etc.
330.description: Most demanding on arms of machine operations series (330s); spine and legs at lower end for 300 series, & same as 331 & 322.

331.name: Machine Tending & Processing
331.description: Observation and control of machinery; occasional stooping required; mechanical adjustments performed; variants similar to 332.

332.name: Observation of Large Stationary Equipment
332.description: Work performed in a plant or other large facility, some mechanical adjustments of machinery performed lowest variants for 300 series for most parts of body.

340.name: Mostly Cleaners
340.description: Work involves cleaning equipment and/or buildings; operation of cleaning devices, some lifting, some climbing, lowest variants for head disabilities of 300 series; lower end of 300 series for arms; highest demands are for spine & leg activities

341.name: Cleaners (working at high levels)
341.description: Work generally performed at high levels – higher end of 300 series for spine & legs; average demands on arms.

350.name: Truck Drivers
350.description: Operate heavy vehicle over public thoroughfares; may do some loading of materials, may tie down loads, may hook up hoses, etc., and performs related duties; head disabilities highest in 300 series.

351.name: Heavy Equipment Operators
351.description: Operates heavy construction equipment at work sites; arm demands at lower end of 300 series; spine & leg demands at higher end of 300 series.

360.name: Porters, Packers
360.description: Significant lifting and carrying required; significant walking required; may occasionally climb at low levels; variants are 'G' for most parts of body; head disabilities are mostly 'F' or lower.

370.name: Mechanical Assembly, Installation, Repairers
370.description: Mechanical work on automobiles, machinery and other equipment, requiring a combination of some skill and significant physical effort; highest variants in 300 series for arm

380.name: Skilled Construction Work
380.description: Work requires construction of buildings or large structure; strenuous demands on arms, legs & spine result in highest variants in 300 series; significant climbing required.

390.name: Security Officers, Coaches
390.description: Inside and outside work requiring significant walking, some uneven ground, and climbing –leg demands are most significant aspect of duties; work may be high risk but not necessarily highly physical; demands for arms & spine are at middle of 300 series.

420.name: Meat Processing +
420.description: Heavy demands placed on arms; spine demand similar to most in 400 series; leg demands lowest in 400 series.

430.name: Machine-assisted Metal Shaping
430.description: Heavy demands on spine & legs in lifting & carrying; work performed at ground level; requires use of heavy hand tools or force with arms.

460.name: Material Handlers & Machine Loaders & Unloaders
460.description: Strenuous demands on spine & legs for lifting and carrying heavy objects; lowest demand for specialized arm activities in 400 series.

470.name: Installers & Repairers
470.description: Strenuous demands on all parts of body – variants are at the higher end of the 400 series.

480.name: Construction Helpers, Oil Field Workers & Some Skilled Construction Workers
480.description: Heavy laboring work at construction sites or other work sites; very strenuous use of spine for lifting and exerting force; heavy demands on arms (similar to 492); leg requirements lower than for 481 & 492.

481.name: Skilled Construction Workers
481.description: Work requires construction of buildings or large structures; skilled work performed at various levels, with significant demands for climbing, but lower demands on legs than 482; strenuous use of arms (same as 470).

482.name: Skilled Construction Workers
482.description: Construction and maintenance work performed at high and dangerous levels – balance required; demands on spine & legs similar to 590; very strenuous use of arms.

490.name: Mostly Sworn Officers – Police & Fire (legal presumptions apply)
490.description: Workers called upon to perform demanding activities in unpredictable and dangerous circumstances; significant demands on all parts of body.

491.name: Agricultural & Livestock Workers
491.description: Work requires tending the land and/or caring for animals; physical demands & variants similar to 460 but slightly lower in mental demands.

492.name: Logging & Fishing Occupations
492.description: Very physical work performed outside; high demand on spine & legs for balancing, working on rugged terrain, and climbing; arm and other variants similar to 560.

493.name: Mostly Professional Athletes
493.description: Substantial athletic performance required but less arduous than Group 590

560.name: Mostly Material Handlers
560.description: Requires lifting of large and/or very heavy objects or exerting very significant force – very strenuous demands placed on spine & legs.

590.name: Mostly Professional Athletes
590.description: Peak athletic performance requiring whole body strength with specialized training and skills; highest variants for all parts of the body.
